title: I cleared my 12th and now I want to prepare for the UPSC. Which type of class course programme should I take in coaching? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: You should choose a discipline for your graduation based on your interest don't fall into the trap as mostly every student does in his/her lifetime ex jee (sabko iit hi karni hai ye kese possible hai) Take time think over the issue and analyse your choices just watching an article on media or a video on any digital platform you can't choose a career In layman's term i can't even tell you how many students have lost their dreams, motivation, and fell into the trap of the aura associated with this examination. Don't want to demotivate you or anyone who is reading this answer just think of your choices before you make them and it's a very long journey ahead first choose a decent career, then ask why civil services if you get to the answer of thso question and if you feel like preparing I'll be more then happy to help Till then read, write, travel, enjoy, socialize, learn a language, skills, play sports and avoid social media at all cost (most importantly follow a disciplined lifestyle) Stay home stay safe Rise and shine

You may opt for the Alternative Classroom Programme for three years. The validity of the programme is for four years, which means all the services will be available at your student portal for four years. For rest of the details, you may contact the admin of the VISION IAS
